related_questions.question: Is this considered an adjective?
related_questions.snippet: The words “this,” “that,” “these” and “those” can function as both demonstrative adjectives and demonstrative pronouns depending on how they are used in a sentence. Demonstrative Adjectives. Demonstrative adjectives are determiners that identify the relative position in time or space of the noun they modify.
related_questions.title: Demonstrative Adjectives and Pronouns - RWU Law

related_questions.question: Is it an adjective or adverb?
related_questions.snippet: To avoid an error, identify what word the adverb or adjective in question modifies. If the word modified is a noun or a pronoun, use an adjective. If the word modified is a verb, an adjective, or another adverb, use an adverb to modify it. Sometimes an adverb is confused with an adjective similar in meaning.
related_questions.title: Adjective or Adverb | Effective Writing Practices Tutorial

text_blocks.snippet: Yes, "informative" is an adjective. It functions as a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun, indicating that something is providing useful or interesting information. For example, one might say "The book was very informative".
